channel.title: Brute Force on TLDRBins
channel.description: Recent content in Brute Force on TLDRBins

item.title: Hydra
item.description: HTTP Basic Auth hydra -L <USERS> -P <PASSWORDS> -s <PORT> -f <TARGET> http-get / +-------------------------------------------+ | -s : port | | -L : usernames file | | -P : passwords file | | -f : exit when a login/pass pair is found | +-------------------------------------------+ Web Page Login Form hydra <TARGET> -l <USER> -P <PASSWORDS> http-post-form '/login.php:username=admin&password=^PASS^&remember=yes:Incorrect password' +-------------------------------------------+ | -l : username | | -P : wordlist | | http-post-form : service | | /login.

item.title: Linux hard disk encryption
item.description: Brute force LUKS password bruteforce-luks -t 10 -f <WORDLIST> -w state.txt -v 30 <BACKUP_IMG> Note: This is slow, create a small wordlist General # Open cryptsetup open --type luks <BACKUP_IMG> backup # Check ls -l /dev/mapper/ # Create mount folder sudo mkdir /mnt/backup # Mount sudo mount /dev/mapper/backup /mnt/backup/

item.title: NetExec (nxc)
item.description: Basic Commands Password NTLM Kerberos # Single user, Single password nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' # Single user, Single password, Local auth nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' --local-auth # Single user, Single password (Active Directory) nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' -d <DOMAIN> # Single user, Multiple passwords nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p <PASSWORDS> -d <DOMAIN> # Multiple users, Single password nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u <USERS> -p '<PASSWORD>' -d <DOMAIN> --continue-on-success # Multiple users, Multiple passwords nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u <USERS> -p <PASSWORDS> -d <DOMAIN> --continue-on-success # Match username to corresponding password nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u <USERS> -p <PASSWORDS> --no-bruteforce --continue-on-success nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -H <HASH> # With Kerberos, or STATUS_ACCOUNT_RESTRICTION (NTLM disabled) sudo ntpdate -s <DC_IP> && nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' -d <DOMAIN> -k # With Kerberos ccache, or STATUS_NOT_SUPPORTED (NTLM disabled) sudo ntpdate -s <DC_IP> && nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -d <DOMAIN> -k --use-kcache Hint: We can also run on multiple targets

item.title: Oracle Database
item.description: Tools sqlplus ODAT # Installation sudo apt install oracle-instantclient-sqlplus # export LD_LIBRARY_PATH export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/usr/lib/oracle/19.6/client64/lib${LD_LIBRARY_PATH:+:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH} # Check sqlplus -V # Installation sudo apt install odat # Check odat --version Ref: Download ODAT Enum # SID enum (You only need one) odat sidguesser -s <TARGET> $ ./odat-libc2.17-x86_64 sidguesser -s 10.129.95.188 [1] (10.129.95.188:1521): Searching valid SIDs [1.1] Searching valid SIDs thanks to a well known SID list on the 10.129.95.188:1521 server [+] 'XE' is a valid SID.
